title: Louise Michel - French Women & Feminists in History: A Resource Guide - Research Guides at Library of Congress

quotes: Louise Michel (1830-1905) was born out of wedlock to a serving maid and the son of the house in Haute-Marne.
Michel moved to Paris in 1865 and opened a school for working class children in Montmartre, where she taught and demonstrated liberal and revolutionary ideas to her pupils.

roles.title: political activist
quotes: A visible political activist of her day and a figurehead for the French anarchist movement, Louise Michel (1830-1905) was born out of wedlock to a serving maid and the son of the house in Haute-Marne.
